item.title: Plutonium found far from Fukushima
item.author: Emma Houghton-Brown,
item.description: Last week, just days before the anniversary of the Fukushima disaster, came evidence that radioactive plutonium has spread much further from the nuclear plant than previously thought. Scientists from the National Institute of Radiological Sciences in Japan, found traces of the potentially harmful …

item.title: Bottoms up in zero-G
item.author: Emma Houghton-Brown,
item.description: Drinking in space can be a messy affair. In the absence of gravity liquid floats, requiring all drinks to be sucked up from a pouch using a straw – a particularly odd sensation when having your hot coffee in the morning. But now, thanks to NASA astronaut Dr. Don Pettit, sipping from an open top cup …

item.title: Look out! Here comes a spider goat
item.author: Emma Houghton-Brown,
item.description: On a small farm, nestled deep in Northern Utah, something extraordinary is happening: creatures are being bred that are part goat, part spider. Last week’s episode of the BBC’s epic science series Horizon followed Adam Rutherford as he journeyed to meet these fascinating hybrids and their creator to …
